Key Match Events: Sri Lanka bowled out England for 156, the lowest all-out total ever in an ODI in Bengaluru
David Willey took two wickets in the initial stages of the match
Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama stitched together a century-plus stand for the third wicket
Ben Stokes hit six fours, the most boundaries for an England batter, in Bengaluru
Adil Rashid was run out by Kusal Mendis with a splendid throw
Mark Wood was stumped in the last wicket to fall
Pre-Game Insights: England skipper Jos Buttler elected to bat first, confirming three changes with Liam Livingstone, Chris Woakes, and Moeen Ali returning
Sri Lanka, who brought Mathews and Kumara back in, ran through England's top and middle-order in Bengaluru to bowl them out for 156
Post-Match Reflections: The result means that England’s defence of their World Cup crown is likely over, with Jos Buttler’s team needing to win all of their remaining results, produce a huge swing in net run rate and see other results go their way to stand any chance of reaching the semi-finals
Sri Lanka, who move up to fifth in the standings with the win, have now won all of their last five Men’s Cricket World Cup meetings with England
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka pacers got the ball to swerve around and Maheesh Theekshana held down an end
Sri Lanka saw off the rest of the new-ball spell before attacking England’s change bowlers of Rashid and Wood, accelerating towards their target
Others: The coin fell in the favour of England skipper Buttler and he elected to bat first
The Lankans also benefitted from some sharp work in the field, which included two run outs
